column1: Many many years back the Captain's wife had been a child herself
column2: and had laughed to see the village mummers act the Peace Egg
column3: and had been quite happy on Christmas Eve. Happy
column4: though she had no mother. Happy
column5: though her father was a stern man
column6: very fond of his only child
column7: but with an obstinate will that not even she dared thwart. She had lived to thwart it
column8: and he had never forgiven her. It was when she married the Captain. The old man had a prejudice against soldiers
column11: for his daughter to sacrifice the happiness of her future life by giving up the soldier she loved. At last he gave her her choice between the Captain and his own favour and money. She chose the Captain
column12: and was disowned and disinherited.The Captain bore a high character
column13: and was a good and clever officer
column14: but that went for nothing against the old man's whim.
